blocks.name: usgr0e
blocks.content: The empty graph, with vertices but no edges, is a simple graph. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 10-Aug-2017.) (Revised by AV, 16-Oct-2020.) (Proof shortened by AV, 25-Nov-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm usgr0e(class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cusgr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(ciedg, c0), emptycls))
} = {
  mpbird(w0, wcel(c0, cusgr), wf1(cfv(ciedg, c0), cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), crab(hs0, cdif(cpw(cfv(cvtx, c0)), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), nat2))))
  f10d(cfv(ciedg, c0), crab(hs0, cdif(cpw(cfv(cvtx, c0)), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), nat2)), w0)
  syl(w0, wb(wcel(c0, cusgr), wf1(cfv(ciedg, c0), cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), crab(hs0, cdif(cpw(cfv(cvtx, c0)), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), nat2)))), wcel(c0, c1))
  isusgr(hs0, c0, c1, cfv(ciedg, c0), cfv(cvtx, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cvtx, c0))
  eqid(cfv(ciedg, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cvtx, c0))
}

  adantr(wcel(c0, cuhgr), wceq(c1, emptycls), wb(wceq(c2, emptycls), wceq(cfv(ciedg, c0), emptycls)))
  syl5bb(wcel(c0, cuhgr), wceq(c2, emptycls), wceq(cfv(ciedg, c0), emptycls), wceq(cfv(cedg, c0), emptycls))
  eqeq1i(c2, emptycls, cfv(cedg, c0))

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cedg, c0))
} = {
  imp(wcel(c0, cuhgr), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), nat0), wceq(cfv(chash, c2), nat0))

  ex(wcel(c0, cuhgr), wceq(c1, emptycls), wceq(c2, emptycls))
  uhgr0v0e(c0, c1, c2)
  ax-mp(wb(wceq(cfv(chash, c1), nat0), wceq(c1, emptycls)), wcel(c1, universe))
  fvexi(c1, cvtx, c0)

blocks.name: usgrprc
blocks.content: The class of simple graphs is a proper class (and therefore, because of ~ prcssprc , the classes of multigraphs, pseudographs and hypergraphs are proper classes, too). (Contributed by AV, 27-Dec-2020.)
